suncertify.ui
Class UIController

java.lang.Object
  suncertify.ui.UIController

public class UIController
extends java.lang.Object

Class centralizing the logic of the database calls using a database connector provided. Controller is responsible for updating the displayed UI with proper data.

Author:
Szymon Bochniak (bochniak.szymon@gmail.com)

Constructor Summary
UIController(ContractorTableModel model, DBConnection dbConn)
          Creates a controller with a database connector for database calls and table model for getting the current UI state.
 
Method Summary
 void bookRow(int rowIndex, java.lang.String ownerId)
          Updates the database row with the ID of the customer who is booking the row.
 void deleteRow(int tableIndex)
          Deletes the row from the database.
 void filter(Contractor criteria)
          Gets data from the database filtered with the criteria given, and updates the UI table with the returned list.
 void insertRow(Contractor newRow)
          Inserts new row into the database.
 void updateRow(int rowIndex, Contractor newRow)

Constructor Detail

UIController

public UIController(ContractorTableModel model,
                    DBConnection dbConn)
Creates a controller with a database connector for database calls and table model for getting the current UI state.

Parameters:
model - table model of the displayed table.
dbConn - database connector used for database calls.
Method Detail

bookRow

public void bookRow(int rowIndex,
                    java.lang.String ownerId)
             throws RecordNotFoundException,
                    SecurityException,
                    java.io.IOException
Updates the database row with the ID of the customer who is booking the row.

Parameters:
rowIndex - index of the row being booked.
ownerId - ID of the customer booking the row.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - if the row being booked cannot be found in the database.
SecurityException - if there was a problem with locking/unlocking the row.
java.io.IOException - if there is an error connecting to the database.

insertRow

public void insertRow(Contractor newRow)
               throws DuplicateKeyException,
                      java.io.IOException,
                      RecordNotFoundException
Inserts new row into the database.

Parameters:
newRow - data of the row to be inserted.
Throws:
DuplicateKeyException - if the row with the same id already exists.
java.io.IOException - if there is an error connecting to the database.
RecordNotFoundException - if the row does not exist right after the insert operation.

deleteRow

public void deleteRow(int tableIndex)
               throws RecordNotFoundException,
                      SecurityException,
                      java.io.IOException
Deletes the row from the database.

Parameters:
tableIndex - index of the row to be deleted.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - if the row being deleted does not exist.
SecurityException - if there was a problem with locking/unlocking the row.
java.io.IOException - if there is an error connecting to the database.

updateRow

public void updateRow(int rowIndex,
                      Contractor newRow)
               throws RecordNotFoundException,
                      SecurityException,
                      java.io.IOException
Updates the database row.

Parameters:
rowIndex - index of the row to be updated.
newRow - updated data of the row.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - if the row to be updated does not exist.
SecurityException - if there was a problem with locking/unlocking the row.
java.io.IOException - if there is an error connecting to the database.

filter

public void filter(Contractor criteria)
            throws java.io.IOException
Gets data from the database filtered with the criteria given, and updates the UI table with the returned list.

Parameters:
criteria - criteria applied to database call.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is an error connecting to the database.
